title: stonehedge
author: stonehedge
content: Hi, I've been helping to build a suite of AI tools for people who trade major tokens. The service is free to access (premium paid-for features coming soon) and will soon be blockchain enabled to provide transparency and an audit trail using the GNY token.I wanted to share it here as Bitcointalk is where my crypto career began way back in 2014 and this has always felt like home  Some features:Trading indicators and charts for top 12 tokens by volume (more coming soon...if you have a token request, just ask!)Live price and volume tickers.Free AI predictive model that forecasts upcoming volatility and potential price changes for all listed tokens. Free daily AI token analysis that uses our 300 trading indicators to provide a market summary for the day.Free daily AI chart analysis that gives an easy to understand summary of all 300 of our trading indicators.A news and events section - a list of upcoming events that have tended to affect crypto prices in the past. Relative Returns Indicator - A method of tracking and comparing live and historic value of tokens.Token Correlations - A method of tracking potential price correlations between tokens.All indicators, charts and models are comprehensively explained in our tooltip knowledgebase to help rookie traders learn!...with much, much more coming soon.Please come by and give it a go...its free! DM or post on this thread with suggestions and token requests.http://gnyrr.comAll the best,Dan

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.created_time: August 29, 2023, 10:20:23 AMLast edit: August 29, 2023, 10:33:45 AM by stonehedge

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Today's ETH AI readout:QuoteThe market for Ethereum has shown a declining trend over the past 7 days. The average price has decreased from $1661.44 on 23rd August to $1649.37 by 28th August. The McClellan Oscillator values have moved closer to zero, indicating a weak bearish momentum. The On Balance Volume (OBV) indicates that the volume of Ethereum sold has slightly increased.The relative strength index (RSI) suggests that the market is near a state of overselling, complimenting the bearish sentiment shown by other indicators. The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicator is still below the signal line and its histogram is decreasing, indicating the bearish momentum is not yet over.Stochastic values are moving in the neutral direction, implying a lack of clear buying or selling pressure. The Average Directional Movement Index (ADX) values have been increasing over the period, indicating a potentially strong trending market. Interestingly, the Parabolic SAR value is below the recent closing price which may suggest a potential upward trend.The Chaikin AD Oscillator, which is positive, reflects a bullish trend on the accumulation/distribution line. However, the Coppock Indicator is negative, hinting at a possible downward price movement in the coming days.No particular chart pattern from the given indicators like Dragonfly Doji, Evening Star, Hammer, or Hikkake Pattern has been seen in the given data which would have helped further in predicting the market direction.To conclude, the market conditions for Ethereum over the studied period have been quite bearish but some conflicting signals from indicators like Chaikin AD Oscillator and Parabolic SAR suggest there might be a potential for a positive price movement. The upcoming trend will depend on how market participants respond to these signals and their sentiments about future market developments. It is advised to follow these indicators and other relevant news closely.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: It looks interesting, what is the free AI predictive model based on, is the price data from 2013 or is there an adjustment to it.Is there human control in re-correcting predictions to give better results, or is all data calculated as it is, regardless of its accuracy?The speed of adjusting expectations caught my attention, which is good. I bookmarked the site and will provide more details in upcoming replies.

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 29, 2023, 11:16:29 AMIt looks interesting, what is the free AI predictive model based on, is the price data from 2013 or is there an adjustment to it.Is there human control in re-correcting predictions to give better results, or is all data calculated as it is, regardless of its accuracy?The speed of adjusting expectations caught my attention, which is good. I bookmarked the site and will provide more details in upcoming replies.Hi!  Fair questions.Firstly, its important to point out that we are not predicting price, we are predicting a range of volatility, essentially a probability band of where we think the max and min price for the token would be.So, no, we are not claiming to be 98% accurate at predicting the precise price of Ethereum on a particular day.  What we are good at is predicting when we think there is a higher chance that the price range might move.If you hover over the historical chart title it should show you the formula used to plot accuracy.  You might also find the tooltips on the chart to the left useful, it explains how our volatitlity range and relative value indicators are calculated (which is the data behind the historical chart we are discussing).Here's a Medium article that i wrote about how the LSTM forecast model works.  https://medium.com/gnylabs/introducing-fabian-gnys-new-machine-learning-engine-6f3fefd93839

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on August 29, 2023, 11:16:29 AMIt looks interesting, what is the free AI predictive model based on, is the price data from 2013 or is there an adjustment to it.Is there human control in re-correcting predictions to give better results, or is all data calculated as it is, regardless of its accuracy?The speed of adjusting expectations caught my attention, which is good. I bookmarked the site and will provide more details in upcoming replies.Sorry, I forgot to answer this question.  The data range of data used to train the models varies for each token.  In summary, the LSTM model is fed candles and indicator values going back to 2017 (for BTC, DOGE, XRP and ETH) or the start of trading for the other tokens.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Seems to be a nice tool. I will add it to my list of tools and keep exploring it further later.I like the market overview part, especially the crypto readouts, news and events. This tool also gives some brief information about the different indicators and the chart readouts are definitely very good for someone who want to learn how to interpret the indicators using TA and how the price might react in the coming days or hours.But what I didn't like was the popup ads when I clicked on "My account" button

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 29, 2023, 11:42:16 AMSeems to be a nice tool. I will add it to my list of tools and keep exploring it further later.I like the market overview part, especially the crypto readouts, news and events. This tool also gives some brief information about the different indicators and the chart readouts are definitely very good for someone who want to learn how to interpret the indicators using TA and how the price might react in the coming days or hours.But what I didn't like was the popup ads when I clicked on "My account" buttonThanks for the feedback, really appreciate it.  The popup is on a timer I think (but not sure) so it was probably coincidence it popped up when you clicked on my account but I'll follow up with the front end team just to be sure.  Do you think its a bit too annoying?The my account section is there for the upcoming premium features (which unfortunately I'm not able to talk about just yet). The free offering will always remain, but there will be a subscription option for people who want to use the advanced features.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: stonehedge on August 29, 2023, 12:05:35 PMThe popup is on a timer I think (but not sure) so it was probably coincidence it popped up when you clicked on my account but I'll follow up with the front end team just to be sure.  Do you think its a bit too annoying?So there's this first one which happens when you scroll through the site. It's just blank and shows nothing while blurring up the background. Even on my browser that has an ad blocker, it pops up. I am not sure if it's an Ad or a notification.And then on clicking my account, something like this will show upYeah, such ads can be a bit to frustrating and intrusive.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: What are the filtering parameters of the featured news in the market overview bar and how often will it be updated? I think it would be good if it includes news that is only relevant for each crypto that users choose.Overall, a very useful tool. Hoping to add more major altcoins.

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on August 29, 2023, 01:37:51 PMWhat are the filtering parameters of the featured news in the market overview bar and how often will it be updated? I think it would be good if it includes news that is only relevant for each crypto that users choose.Overall, a very useful tool. Hoping to add more major altcoins.The news feed is a combo of manually entered events and aggregated CSS feeds, but its all manually curated by a colleague to make sure its relevant.Good suggestion regarding crypto specific news...i'll feed that back to the team. Thank you!We're over doubling the supported number of tokens soon (we're using marketcap as the guidelines for demand) but we are always on the lookout for suggestions for popular tokens to add...feel free to suggest here or on Twitter etc.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 29, 2023, 01:09:24 PMSo there's this first one which happens when you scroll through the site. It's just blank and shows nothing while blurring up the background. Even on my browser that has an ad blocker, it pops up. I am not sure if it's an Ad or a notification.I can confirm this happens on my end. My adblocker is also turned on, so I believe it is one of your pop-ups for new visitors. It can be annoying since there is no text or anything at all, which can be interpreted as a phishing pop-up.By the way, I believe the homepage is quite overwhelming for new users. At the very least that's what I felt when I visit your website. Maybe it would be a good idea to organize them into separate sections instead. For example, "trading info", "crypto news", etc. Users would need to click on those links to view the content, so they don't have to navigate everything just to find a moving average chart for example.

comments.author: stonehedge
comments.body: Quote from: joniboini on August 30, 2023, 07:12:03 AMQuote from: Bitcoin_Arena on August 29, 2023, 01:09:24 PMSo there's this first one which happens when you scroll through the site. It's just blank and shows nothing while blurring up the background. Even on my browser that has an ad blocker, it pops up. I am not sure if it's an Ad or a notification.I can confirm this happens on my end. My adblocker is also turned on, so I believe it is one of your pop-ups for new visitors. It can be annoying since there is no text or anything at all, which can be interpreted as a phishing pop-up.By the way, I believe the homepage is quite overwhelming for new users. At the very least that's what I felt when I visit your website. Maybe it would be a good idea to organize them into separate sections instead. For example, "trading info", "crypto news", etc. Users would need to click on those links to view the content, so they don't have to navigate everything just to find a moving average chart for example.Thanks for this.  The front end guys are reading this thread and I've mentioned it to them seperately. I think the popup is a signup for the newsletter rather than a third party ad but either way what you describe is annoying.Thanks also for the feedback on the page being overwhelming and needing to be broken up.  I think you're right. We are working on changing the layout for our next major release but I'll make sure your feedback is added to the picture so we can improve usability for new users.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: stonehedge on August 30, 2023, 12:55:05 PMI think you're right. We are working on changing the layout for our next major release but I'll make sure your feedback is added to the picture so we can improve usability for new users.  Could you also consider making the chart colors customizable for the users, if it is possible? For example, the Blue and Green for BTC GNY historical accuracy especially at the pints where they meet seem a little tricky to an eye or some of our eyes (Like me who is to some extent Red-Green color-blind)Maybe using primary colors can help like Blue and yellow and the point where the two meet can be a secondary color Green, or you can just let a user choose the color scheme they want.

comments.author: Cobgoblincave4
comments.body: Last week's accuracy percentages relating to the GNY Range Report's volatility forecasts for 12 tokens. XRP & MATIC being a bit difficult, but we will rein them in.    https://i.ibb.co/NFXdphw/4-sept-accuracy.jpg

comments.author: John_Muck
comments.created_time: September 05, 2023, 05:44:54 PMLast edit: September 05, 2023, 05:58:37 PM by John_Muck
comments.body: Hi all.John_Muck here from the GNY Range Report team.I agree with Cobgoblincave4 that we are hitting a bit of a bump in the road with the accuracy figures for XRP; currently sitting at 75.54% when forecasting price volatility. I am confident though that we will get it up into the 90's like many of the other tokens we cover.Latest forecast and historical for XRP below as an example.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: John_Muck on September 05, 2023, 05:44:54 PMI agree with Cobgoblincave4 that we are hitting a bit of a bump in the road with the accuracy figures for XRP; currently sitting at 75.54% when forecasting price volatility. I am confident though that we will get it up into the 90's like many of the other tokens we cover.Latest forecast and historical for XRP below as an example.So how do you improve the accuracy? Do you feed new data or is there any tweak to the algorithm? I believe some coins are just wildly volatile since their fundamental changes quickly like XRP after the SEC case, so it is not surprising if your current model failed to stay within 90% like other coins. People should be aware that this 'prediction' can't correctly express any change in fundamental values if I get your explanation correctly.
